description: Number of ways of expressing an n-cycle in the symmetric group S_n as a product of n+1 transpositions.
comments: For n >= 3 a(n) = A060348(n) * n. The number of ways of expressing an n-cycle in the symmetric group S_n as a product of n-1 transpositions was given in the comment to A000272.
references: D. M. Jackson - Some Combinatorial Problems Associated with Products of Conjugacy Classes of the Symmetric Group, Journal of combinatorial theory Seies A, 49 363-369(1988).
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
example: a(2) = 1 because in S_2 the only way to write (12) as a product of 3 transpositions is: (12) = (12)(12)(12).
maple: for n from 1 to 30 do printf(`%d,`,1/24 * (n^2 - 1) * n^(n + 1)) od:
prog: (PARI) { for (n=1, 200, write("b060603.txt", n, " ", (n^2 - 1) * n^(n + 1)/24); ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 07 2009]
author: Dan Fux (dan.fux(AT)OpenGaia.com or danfux(AT)OpenGaia.com), Apr 13 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 13 2001
